review_title: Great Company with a Great History
job_title: Chief Operating Officer in Los Angeles, CA
pros: QHC is a fantastic place to work. The mission of the organization is firmly cemented in taking care of the community and provided vitally needed health care services. The people at QHC make a difference in the lives of people in the community and have a heart for service. We are rapidly emerging as a highly efficient, patient-centered organization. The organization is very data driven and adhere to evidence based practices that are to the benefit of the patient and staff. Most recently, we have expanded our behavioral (mental) health services and are continuing to grow.
cons: QHC provides care to patients that have government sponsored coverages that come with many strings attached that includes collecting information from our clients that would otherwise not be required with employer sponsored coverage. Additionally, some services are not covered by these government sponsored programs which makes it challenging to provide everything each of our clients need and do so affordably. Fortunately we have a sliding fee discount program to help fill those needs.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great area to work in Queenscare. Great Team. Every Pharmacist show empathy toward our patients. Every Pharmacist wants to help every patients in any way they can to explaining their new medication to finding a affordable options for them. The technicians are knowledgeable and hard workers. They are always willing to help others. The techs are their for the patients they have a heart for the work. Everyone is flexible with your schedule. Everyone is a hard worker
cons: No cons at this moment

job_title: Director of Pharmacy in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Our mission is to provide quality primary healthcare that is accessible to any patient in need in the communities we serve, regardless of ability to pay. Employees are passionate about the mission and go the extra mile for our patients. It was fantastic to see the collaboration and teamwork between different departments during the pandemic. A great place to work with a great group of Directors/Managers leading the way.
cons: None to share at the moment

job_title: Pharmacist in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
- Great company that provides great services for low income population, it feels good to be able to help the local community.
- Stable work hours which are Monday through Friday, weekends off, and paid holidays off.
- Great benefits, medical/dental/vision, 403b retirement plan (company also matches our contribution).
- QueensCare is a qualified employer for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) after 10 years
cons: For some positions there is no room for growth or promotion

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Hollywood, CA
pros: Great benefits. You gain knowledge that you can apply at other jobs. Management is approachable.
cons: The division of labor isn’t divided fairly. You can have mean coworkers that gossip and never get in trouble for it.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician CPhT in Hollywood, CA

job_title: Communications Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
I have been with QHC for a little less than a year, and I can honestly say it has been one of the best professional experiences in my career. I am a part of the most diverse group of professionals who value and support one another. I am most pleased with the way my supervisors and colleagues value and respect my work. I feel like I am honestly making a difference and leaving my mark to fulfill our mission. 

The COVID-19 pandemic has solidified our values as an organization and makes me very proud to work for an organization that values its employees. In the face of all this loss, QHC has managed to secure hazard pay for our front-line health heroes! That is amazing to me!
cons: Honestly, I have no cons based on my experience.

review_title: Good Intention but is it worth it?
job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The work is meaningful. (Although this can be said about practically all health centers in a similar setting.)
cons: Poor communication. Current CMO has obviously no past CMO experience and the general consensus of him amongst my colleagues is that he's doing a pretty poor job. Providers are starting to leave for obvious reasons.  I wouldn't be surprised if more follow in the next few months.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great vision and mission, a great service to the community.
cons: Providers do not feel appreciated. They are overworked and upper management only seems to care about how many visits they can squeeze out of you. They state that patient quality care is their objective but current policies and organizational structures do not support that ideal. The organization is top heavy with directors and administrators and provider turn-over is an issue.

job_title: Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Benefits are comparable to other health care organizations. Competitive pay. Diverse. Good balance of age groups. Changes in Management have led to recent modernization of processes.
cons: Small organization and a non-profit, so you sometimes end up doing lots of legwork.
